comments.body: How about including refManager too? Then we can invoke `refManager.GenerateContainerRef` in RunContainer(), so we can get rid of `ref`. That's something I missed to do in recent PRs..

@yifan-gu In order the create the reference to the container?  If so, I noticed that the generateContainerReference method doesn't use any of the ref manager state -- it could be a utility method we could just call here.
@pmorie Yes. But we missed the `SetRef` part here after container creation, right?

@yifan-gu i moved that back to kubelet runContainer
